claim: The only hair color associated with a 185 cm tall human superhero is red; there are no blond, brown, black, brown/white, or hairless cases.
extra_info: 185 cm tall refers to height_cm = 185; human superhero refers to race = 'human'; hair colour refers to colour where hair_colour_id = colour.id;
reasoning: The database shows that 185 cm tall human superheroes have hair colors including Blond, Brown, Black, Brown/White, and No Colour. Red hair is not present at all among them, directly contradicting the claim that red is the only hair color for this group.

content.thinking: Let me explore the database schema and then verify the claim.

input.description: List all tables in the database

content.content:
alignment       colour          hero_attribute  publisher       superhero     
attribute       gender          hero_power      race            superpower

tool_use_result.stdout:
alignment       colour          hero_attribute  publisher       superhero     
attribute       gender          hero_power      race            superpower

content.content:
CREATE TABLE superhero
(
    id             INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    superhero_name TEXT default NULL,
    full_name      TEXT default NULL,
    gender_id      INTEGER          default NULL,
    eye_colour_id  INTEGER          default NULL,
    hair_colour_id INTEGER          default NULL,
    skin_colour_id INTEGER          default NULL,
    race_id        INTEGER          default NULL,
    publisher_id   INTEGER          default NULL,
    alignment_id   INTEGER          default NULL,
    height_cm      INTEGER          default NULL,
    weight_kg      INTEGER          default NULL,
    foreign key (alignment_id) references alignment(id),
    foreign key (eye_colour_id) references colour(id),
    foreign key (gender_id) references gender(id),
    foreign key (hair_colour_id) references colour(id),
    foreign key (publisher_id) references publisher(id),
    foreign key (race_id) references race(id),
    foreign key (skin_colour_id) references colour(id)
);

tool_use_result.stdout:
CREATE TABLE superhero
(
    id             INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    superhero_name TEXT default NULL,
    full_name      TEXT default NULL,
    gender_id      INTEGER          default NULL,
    eye_colour_id  INTEGER          default NULL,
    hair_colour_id INTEGER          default NULL,
    skin_colour_id INTEGER          default NULL,
    race_id        INTEGER          default NULL,
    publisher_id   INTEGER          default NULL,
    alignment_id   INTEGER          default NULL,
    height_cm      INTEGER          default NULL,
    weight_kg      INTEGER          default NULL,
    foreign key (alignment_id) references alignment(id),
    foreign key (eye_colour_id) references colour(id),
    foreign key (gender_id) references gender(id),
    foreign key (hair_colour_id) references colour(id),
    foreign key (publisher_id) references publisher(id),
    foreign key (race_id) references race(id),
    foreign key (skin_colour_id) references colour(id)
);

input.command: sqlite3 -header -column "/Users/david/workspace/claude-code-claimdb/test_dbs/superhero.sqlite" "SELECT s.superhero_name, c.colour AS hair_colour, s.height_cm FROM superhero s JOIN race r ON s.race_id = r.id JOIN colour c ON s.hair_colour_id = c.id WHERE s.height_cm = 185 AND r.race = 'Human';"
input.description: Find hair colors of 185cm tall human superheroes

content.text:
The query results clearly show that 185 cm tall human superheroes have multiple hair colors: Blond, Brown, Black, Brown/White, and No Colour — not just Red. In fact, **Red** doesn't appear at all among them.
